Articles.Content:
[Link](http://www.pcgamer.com/kerbal-space-program-review/) to the review.

> 
> Occasionally, though, you'll be floating in space and the sun will emerge from behind Kerbin, or you'll catch the distant glint of another planet. At distance, the engine's lighting excels. In motion, KSP is fully able to sell the majesty and awe of space exploration.
> It's a reminder: we did that. On the back of science, yearning and, yes, a nearly apocalyptic competition between two superpowers, we strapped people into giant combustible machines and shot them out of our planet. We did that, and it was amazing. Kerbal Space Program is . . . brilliant because it holds a mirror up to one of humanity's greatest achievements, and only does so when you have the greatest possible appreciation for the skill, dedication and courage involved. It's a rare and wonderful game, and deserves the strongest possible recommendation.

Yeah, that sums it up for me.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-01T20:08:33Z" title="05/01/2015 08:08  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 1, 2015</time> by Mr Shifty**

I think SQUAD's just won PC Gamer. I knew this was deserved, but to see it there speaks volumes. 

In all seriousness, KSP knocks it out the park, and that sort of rating puts it up there among the greats.
So much for the "KSP will get killed in reviews" stuff. While there were legitimate concerns, I was SHOCKED how negative people were about the entire process of Squad pushing to 1.0.

> 
> So much for the "KSP will get killed in reviews" stuff. While there were legitimate concerns, I was SHOCKED how negative people were about the entire process of Squad pushing to 1.0.

Yes. All of that negativity was clearly bogus.

Heh, the only other game (that I remember seeing) PC Gamer rated higher than that was Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri at 98%.

Either way, congrats Squad!

There's a thread for this already:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/118058-Media-feedback-reviews-on-KSP-1-0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/118058-Media-feedback-reviews-on-KSP-1-0)
